QueryViewSpec.Name: Statements Dates Query
QueryViewSpec.Description: This is used to determine the dates used during the statements process
QueryViewSpec.Author: Cary Mayeda

ViewImplementation.ViewSQL:
select ID, dateadd(day, 1, dateadd(month, datediff(month, 0, dateadd(month, -1, getdate())), 0)) as FIRSTDAYOFTHECURRENTSTATEMENTSPERIOD, dateadd(month, datediff(month, 0, getdate()), 0) as LASTDAYOFTHECURRENTSTATEMENTSPERIOD, dateadd(month, -1, dateadd(month, datediff(month, 0, getdate()), 0)) as LASTDAYOFTHEPREVIOUSSTATEMENTSPERIOD, dateadd(year, datediff(year, 0, getdate()), 0) as FIRSTDAYOFCALENDARYEAR, dateadd(month, datediff(month, 0, getdate()), 0) as FIRSTDAYOFCURRENTMONTH, dateadd(day, -1, dateadd(month, datediff(month, 0, getdate()), 0)) as LASTDAYOFTHEPREVIOUSMONTH, dateadd(day, -1, dateadd(month, datediff(month, 0, dateadd(month, 3, getdate())), 0)) as LASTDAYOFTHEMONTHTWOMONTHSINTHEFUTURE
from dbo.CONSTITUENT

OutputField.Name: FIRSTDAYOFTHECURRENTSTATEMENTSPERIOD
OutputField.Caption: First Day of Current Statements Period

OutputField.Name: LASTDAYOFTHECURRENTSTATEMENTSPERIOD
OutputField.Caption: Last Day of Current Statements Period

OutputField.Name: LASTDAYOFTHEPREVIOUSSTATEMENTSPERIOD
OutputField.Caption: First Day of Previous Statements Period

OutputField.Name: FIRSTDAYOFCALENDARYEAR
OutputField.Caption: First Day of the Current Calendar Year

OutputField.Name: LASTDAYOFTHEMONTHTWOMONTHSINTHEFUTURE
OutputField.Caption: Last Day of the Month Two Months in the Future
